description: The cumulative update KB5040427 for Windows 10 versions 21H2 and 22H2 has introduced a change in the behavior of Microsoft Copilot, which now functions more like a standalone application. This transition can lead to unexpected display settings for users, affecting how Copilot is rendered on the desktop. Administrators may observe that settings related to Copilot's appearance and functionality revert or adjust post-update. Moreover, there are inquiries about the possibility of disabling Copilot entirely following this patch, indicating users are experiencing disruptions in their workflow. Such changes can impact system usability and require additional configuration adjustments from IT staff to restore desired user experiences.
